intro: Aiouea chavarriana, commonly known as the Hawaiian aiouea, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the family Lauraceae, which includes laurels and cinnamon trees. The plant is characterized by its aromatic leaves and small, clustered white or yellowish flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within the mesic and wet forests of Hawaii. Aiouea chavarriana is also valued for its ecological role in supporting native insect and bird populations.
